metadata.description:
The Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF; Skamarock et al. 2008)) model is used to create this dataset associated with the TPEMIP project. Initial and boundary conditions are provided from ERA-interim (Dee et al. 2011) and OISST (Reynolds et al. 2007; Banzon et al. 2016). Horizontal resolution is 0.18 x 0.18 degree and output format is netcdf. A calculation period (output period) is from 00Z21April to 00Z01September (from 00Z01May to 23Z31August) each year. The dataset of 2003 test run is uploaded until March 31, 2020 (v1), and all the runs will be done until December 31, 2020 (v2).

background: Subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) prediction of droughts and floods is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction. Recent studies suggest that the springtime land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau (TP) can be a new source of S2S predictability. The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Sea surface temperature (SST) variations such as those associated with the Madden-Julian Oscillations are known to provide a predictability source. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.

The background temperature gradient at midlatitudes also affects the activity of baroclinic eddies (Xue et al., 2023), which can further reinforce the zonal wind changes and further influence the zonal wind downstream as the eddies move downstream and interact with the zonal flow. The response of the zonal wind in the downstream of TP is consistent with these studies, exhibiting a significant deceleration of the zonal wind along the jet core over the North Pacific. Meanwhile, a significant acceleration of the zonal wind is found to the north of the jet core, indicating a slight northward shift of the jet stream. Such changes in the zonal wind have their counterparts in the observations (see Fig. 4b). One salient feature in Fig. 5a is the strong negative geopotential height anomaly over the TP at 200 hPa, accompanied with a cyclonic anomalous circulation. Such a circulation response corresponds to the cold anomaly over the TP, where the atmosphere sinks and induces negative potential height anomalies at upper levels. Furthermore, evident wave-like patterns downstream from the TP to the North Pacific are shown in the geopotential height difference in Fig. 5a. The negative center of geopotential height anomaly over the TP extends eastward to Japan, while a strong positive geopotential height center with anticyclonic circulation flow emerges to the east over the Bering Strait with a center around 170°E, 50°N. The wave-like geopotential height differences further extend from the Rocky Mountain across the North American continent, North Atlantic Ocean, and back to the Eurasian continent. The above simulated response in atmospheric circulations is in general consistent with the observed geopotential height anomalies in May 2003 (Fig. 5b). In addition, responses in the geopotential height to the cold TP surface are also noticed in the Southern Hemisphere, especially in the midlatitudes (Fig. 5a, b). Therefore, we also inspect the anomalous stream function from the simulated wind. The WAF is parallel to the group velocity of Rossby waves and can approximately indicate the wave energy propagation.

Although the teleconnections caused by the heating due to oceanic temperature anomalies, such as those between ENSO and the Asian monsoons, have been extensively investigated (e.g., Wang et al. 2000; Li et al. 2007; Li et al. 2017), the remote effects of mountain heating on global atmospheric circulations have not been fully studied. The LS4P-I experiment provides a chance to explore the detailed features of the TRC wave train as well as the global response of atmospheric circulations to the TP surface anomaly. It is well known and extensively studied that the TP surface thermal state can significantly influence the weather and climate in East Asia (e.g. Liu et al. 2020). Earlier studies have shown that, in summertime, there exists a circumglobal teleconnection pattern (CTP) in the extra-tropics of the Northern Hemisphere along the westerly jet. The latent heat with the strong convective monsoon precipitation is suggested a major driver for the CTP (e.g. Lau and Peng 1991; Lau and Weng 2002; Lau et al. 2004 ; Ding and Wang 2005; Ding et al. 2011).
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment. More dynamical understanding of the TRC wave train as well as its cross-equator propagation into the Southern Hemisphere will be explored in the newly launched LS4P phase II experiment.

This study has investigated the mechanisms of the global atmospheric response to the TP spring LST/SUBT anomalies in simulations by LS4P-I ESMs. To further explore the TP’s role and the influence of TRC wave train in S2S predictions, we check the response simulated by each model in May. These results taken together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations.
Our aim is to place the TP LST/SUBT’s influence on the global atmospheric circulations with a focus on the dynamical feature of the TRC wave train and its importance for improving S2S prediction.
challenges: However, the simulated propagation pathways from the TP into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences.

However, there are phase differences between the simulated wave train and the observations. However, over the regions from the North Atlantic to the Ural Mountains, the observed geopotential height anomalies show opposite signs to the multi-model average, suggesting that in those regions the TP surface cooling may not be the major cause for the observed circulation anomalies. The main difference is that the simulated atmospheric response in model ensemble evolve faster than the observation. The associated diversities in the model response in the Southern Hemispheric circulations could be one of the main reasons that the simulated response exhibit great inconsistency with the observation, though the model ensembles show strong Southern Hemispheric responses especially in the mid-high latitudes.

Compared with the observation, none of the LS4P-I ESMs well captures the observed T2m cold anomaly in May 2003. The ensemble mean of the 16 LS4P-I ESMs exhibits a warm bias of 1.02 °C over the TP, which is stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation of TP T2m (about 0.7 °C). The spatial distribution of the model bias for the ensemble mean is shown in Fig. 1b, which shows a clear warm bias in May 2003 T2m over the eastern part of the TP. The LS4P-I simulations further show that the TP surface thermal state not only has circumglobal influence in the Northern Hemisphere, but it also affects the extratropical atmospheric circulation in the Southern Hemisphere, though with a large uncertainty due to inter-model variability.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The ensemble mean of simulated 200 hPa geopotential height difference is also illustrated in Fig. 5a together with the observations for May 2003 (Fig. 5b), to further explore the atmospheric circulation responses to the TP LST/SUBT effect.

The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. All data are provided at 0.5° × 0.5° spatial resolution. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis (Harris et al. 2014; 2020).
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. The TRC wave train modulated by the TP thermal anomaly play a critical role on the early summer surface air temperature and precipitation anomalies in the regions along the wave train, especially over the northwest North America and the southern Great Plains. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned.

These results taking together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations. The ensemble model simulations show that, with the strong westerly jet across the extratropical Asian-Pacific region, the TP surface cooling generates a barotropic, persistent (evolving in time scales longer than a month) TRC wave train from TP through northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the west part of the North America, whose features closely resemble the observed geopotential height anomaly from May to June in 2003.

The key features of the simulated ensemble mean of June precipitation in response to the TP LST/SUBT effect were discussed in Xue et al. (2022). The LS4P-I experiment, however, shows that the TP surface anomaly can result in persistent and global scale anomalies in atmospheric circulations, and has a near-global influence on the summer T2m and precipitation on S2S time scale. Furthermore, the LS4P-I experiment confirms and highlights the important even critical role of the TRC wave train in the global influence of the TP surface anomaly. The analysis of 16 state-of-the-art ESMs shows for the first time that the springtime TP surface anomaly can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic TRC wave train.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）预测干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的主要挑战之一。最近的研究表明，春季青藏高原（TP）的地表温度/地下温度（LST/SUBT）可以成为S2S预测的新来源。成功预测亚季节到季节（S2S）时间尺度上的干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的一大挑战，失败可能导致对社会和经济产生重大不利影响。海表温度（SST）变化，例如与麦登-朱利安振荡相关的变化，已知提供了预测的来源。最近的研究表明，春季地表/地下温度（LST/SUBT）在S2S时间尺度上提供了新的可预测性来源。全球能源与水循环交换（GEWEX）计划已启动“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测影响（LS4P）”项目，以研究春季LST/SUBT异常对夏季降水预测的影响。

中纬度的背景温度梯度也影响了斜压涡旋的活动（Xue et al., 2023），这进一步增强了纬向风的变化，并在涡旋向下游移动并与纬向流相互作用时进一步影响下游的纬向风。青藏高原下游的纬向风响应与这些研究一致，表现为北太平洋喷流核心区域的纬向风显著减速。同时，在喷流核心的北侧发现了纬向风的显著加速，表明喷流略微向北偏移。这种纬向风的变化在观测中也有对应（见图4b）。图5a中的一个显著特征是青藏高原上方200 hPa的强负位势高度异常，伴随着气旋异常环流。这种环流响应对应于青藏高原上的冷异常，导致大气下沉并在上层诱发负位势高度异常。此外，图5a中显示了从青藏高原到北太平洋的明显波状模式的位势高度差。青藏高原上方的负位势高度异常中心向东延伸至日本，而在白令海峡东侧出现了一个强正位势高度中心，伴随反气旋环流，中心位于约170°E，50°N。波状位势高度差进一步从落基山脉延伸穿过北美大陆、北大西洋，回到欧亚大陆。上述大气环流的模拟响应总体上与2003年5月的观测位势高度异常一致（图5b）。此外，在南半球，尤其是在中纬度地区，也注意到对青藏高原表面冷异常的位势高度响应（图5a，b）。因此，我们还检查了模拟风场的异常流函数。波动能量通量（WAF）与罗斯贝波的群速度平行，能够大致指示波能量的传播。

尽管由于海洋温度异常引起的热带遥相关（teleconnections），例如ENSO与亚洲季风之间的关系，已经得到了广泛研究（例如，Wang等，2000；Li等，2007；Li等，2017），但山地加热对全球大气环流的远程影响尚未得到充分研究。LS4P-I实验提供了一个机会，以探索TRC波列的详细特征以及大气环流对青藏高原表面异常的全球响应。众所周知，青藏高原的热状态可以显著影响东亚的天气和气候（例如，Liu等，2020）。早期研究表明，在夏季，北半球的副热带地区沿着西风急流存在一个环全球遥相关模式（CTP）。强对流季风降水的潜热被认为是CTP的主要驱动因素（例如，Lau和Peng 1991；Lau和Weng 2002；Lau等，2004；Ding和Wang 2005；Ding等，2011）。
research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化陆面温度和雪盖对季节内到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季陆面温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了16个参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的当前先进地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季天山地区陆面降温的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。对热带环流波列及其向南半球的跨赤道传播的动态理解将在新启动的LS4P第二阶段实验中进行深入探讨。
本研究调查了LS4P-I ESMs模拟中全球大气对青藏 Plateau（TP）春季地表温度/地下温度异常的响应机制。为了进一步探索TP的作用及热带环流（TRC）波列在短期到季节预测中的影响，我们检查了每个模型在五月的响应。这些结果表明，TRC波列在TP的地表和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，特别是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列如何影响这些不同区域的降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。
我们的目标是将热带太平洋海表温度/海洋温度对全球大气环流的影响与热带环流波列的动力特征结合起来，重点关注其在改善季节到季节预测中的重要性。
challengesCn: 然而，从热带地区向南半球的模拟传播路径显示出较大的模型间差异。
然而，模拟的波列与观测之间存在相位差。然而，从北大西洋到乌拉尔山脉的区域，观测到的地势高度异常与多模型平均值显示出相反的符号，这表明在这些区域，地表冷却可能不是观测到的环流异常的主要原因。主要的区别在于，模型集合中模拟的大气响应演变速度快于观测。南半球环流中模型响应的相关多样性可能是模拟响应与观测之间存在巨大不一致的主要原因之一，尽管模型集合在南半球中高纬度地区显示出强烈的响应。

与观测相比，LS4P-I ESMs 并未很好地捕捉到 2003 年 5 月 T2m 的寒冷异常。16 个 LS4P-I ESM 的集合均值在青藏高原（TP）上表现出 1.02 °C 的暖偏差，这一偏差强于 TP T2m 的观测年际变化标准差（约 0.7 °C）。模型集合均值的偏差空间分布如图 1b 所示，显示出 2003 年 5 月 TP 东部地区 T2m 明显的暖偏差。LS4P-I 模拟进一步表明，TP 表面的热状态不仅对北半球具有全球影响，还影响南半球的温带大气环流，尽管由于模型间的变异性，这一影响存在较大不确定性。
methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的全球影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与TP 5月表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP气温上的偏差。
datasetCn: 模拟的200 hPa位势高度差的集合均值也在图5a中展示，并与2003年5月的观测结果（图5b）一起，进一步探讨了大气环流对青藏 Plateau地表温度/土壤湿度效应的响应。

在图1a中显示了青藏高原（TP）观察到的T2m异常，我们使用来自美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS，Fan和van den Dool 2008）的数据。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气重分析（ERA5，Hersbach等，2020），该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的规则水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。所有数据均以0.5° × 0.5°的空间分辨率提供。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位（CRU），在实施分析时使用版本4.02（Harris等，2014；2020）。
findingsCn: LS4P-I的结果首次表明，春季的表面温度异常可以通过东北亚和白令海峡调节一个持久的准纬向青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球波列（TRC波列），并影响从青藏 Plateau 跨越整个北太平洋盆地的春季西风急流。由青藏 Plateau 热异常调节的 TRC 波列在波列沿线地区，特别是在北美西北部和南部大平原，对初夏的表面气温和降水异常起着关键作用。这些结果表明，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过 TRC 波列是上述地区季节到季节（S2S）变率的主要来源。

这些结果综合表明，青藏 Plateau（TP）的波列在影响TP表面和地下温度对热点区域的作用中发挥了关键作用，特别是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列影响这些不同区域降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。集合模型模拟显示，在亚太地区的强西风急流下，TP表面降温产生了一个从TP经过东北亚和白令海峡延伸到北美西部的条带状、持久性（演变时间尺度超过一个月）的TRC波列，其特征与2003年5月至6月观察到的地势高度异常非常相似。

Xue et al. (2022) 讨论了响应于青藏 Plateau (TP) 地表温度/土壤湿度效应的六月降水模拟集合均值的关键特征。然而，LS4P-I 实验表明，TP 表面异常可以导致大气环流的持续和全球尺度异常，并对季节到季节的时间尺度上的夏季气温 (T2m) 和降水产生近全球影响。此外，LS4P-I 实验确认并强调了热带环流 (TRC) 波列在 TP 表面异常全球影响中的重要甚至关键作用。对 16 个先进的地球系统模型 (ESMs) 的分析首次表明，春季 TP 表面异常可以调节一个持续的准气旋性 TRC 波列。

background: Subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation prediction in boreal spring and summer months, despite including large number of high-impact events, such as droughts/floods, has remained poor for years. Tibetan Plateau (TP) spring observed surface temperatures show a lag correlation with summer precipitation in several remote regions, but current global land–atmosphere coupled models are unable to represent this behavior due to significant errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures. The land’s role in the climate system at various scales has been the subject of much research since the 1970s. A few land surface attributes, such as albedo, soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation, and aerosols in snow have been extensively investigated to explore their roles in land–atmosphere interactions. Ocean state is well known to play a major role in modulating Earth’s climate. The linkage of hydrological events to sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies, such as El Niño and La Niña, has been used to predict climate events with useful skill at long lead times ranging from a few months to a few years. However, studies have also consistently shown that the SST only partially explains climate predictability. Recent preliminary studies based on observational data and modeling have indicated that spring land temperature in the Rocky Mountains and the Tibetan Plateau (TP) could affect summer drought/flood in their respective downstream regions with a magnitude comparable to the SST effect and atmospheric internal variability. Although land surface 2-m air temperature (T2m) measurements have the best quality and longest record among various land surface variables with global coverage, their application in land–atmosphere interaction studies, S2S prediction in particular, has largely been overlooked.
research objective: To address these issues, the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program launched the “Impact of Initialized Land Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal-to-Seasonal Prediction” (LS4P) initiative as a community effort to test the impact of land temperature in high-mountain regions on S2S prediction by climate models. This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here. The LS4P objective is to examine whether the observed cold May 2003 TP anomaly causes the observed remote June precipitation anomalies over hotspots worldwide.
challenges: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical to this effort yet remain scientifically challenging. Most studies of land–atmosphere interactions have been limited by a lack of observational data and tend to focus on local feedbacks. Current state-of-the-art ESMs are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. There are two issues that need further investigation: 1) The ensemble-mean-produced T2m difference is smaller than the observed anomaly. Would this deficiency cause an underestimation of the TP T2m effect? 2) In some areas, the ensemble mean produces a significant June precipitation difference, such as in western Australia and western Europe, but with the opposite sign compared to the observation. Is this due to a model deficiency in its ability to produce the full TP T2m anomaly and/or correct precipitation anomaly, and/or some other processes involved?
methods: In this study, observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between the TP T2m and global precipitation and to identify the locations (hotspots) where the initialization of TP May land temperatures may enhance June precipitation prediction skill. Two pairs of experiments with 16 state-of-the-art LS4P ESMs (Table ES1) have been conducted. In the first experiment (referred to as control run), we evaluate whether the ESMs can properly produce the observed TP T2m anomaly in May 2003 and the June precipitation anomaly. To alleviate the ESMs’ May TP T2m bias and to generate the observed cold TP spring anomaly, we introduce an innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the TP. After adjusting the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model’s T2m bias and observed anomaly over the TP, a second experiment (referred to as the sensitivity run) is conducted using the new LST/SUBT initial condition for each model over the TP, with all other initial and boundary conditions and ensemble members identical to the first experiment.
dataset: In this study, the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data, which consist in 80 stations over the TP and more than 2,400 stations over all of China, are used over China. The Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) T2m data are used elsewhere. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data are used for precipitation over globe.
findings: This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here; the ensemble means in some “hotspots” produce more than 40% of the observed anomalies. Consistent results from observations and multiple ESM experiments show that improving the May TP land temperature simulation through LST/SUBT initialization over the TP allows ESMs to better predict June precipitation over hotspots, and that the LST over high-mountain areas could be a new source of S2S predictability through elevated heating.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）降水预测在北半球春季和夏季月份中，尽管包括大量高影响事件，如干旱/洪水，但多年来预测效果仍然较差。青藏 Plateau（TP）春季观测的地表温度与多个远程地区的夏季降水存在滞后相关性，但当前的全球陆气耦合模型由于在产生观测到的TP地表温度方面存在显著误差，无法表现出这种行为。自1970年代以来，土地在气候系统中不同尺度的作用一直是许多研究的主题。一些土地表面属性，如反照率、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被和雪中的气溶胶，已被广泛研究以探讨它们在陆气相互作用中的作用。海洋状态众所周知在调节地球气候中发挥着重要作用。水文事件与海表温度（SST）异常的联系，如厄尔尼诺和拉尼娜，已被用于预测气候事件，并在几个月到几年范围内提供有用的技能。然而，研究也一致表明，SST仅部分解释气候可预测性。基于观测数据和建模的近期初步研究表明，落基山脉和青藏高原（TP）的春季地面温度可能影响各自下游地区的夏季干旱/洪水，其影响程度与SST效应和大气内部变率相当。尽管地表2米气温（T2m）测量在各种地表变量中具有最佳质量和最长记录，并且具有全球覆盖，但在陆气相互作用研究中，特别是在S2S预测中的应用仍然被忽视。
research objectiveCn: 为了解决这些问题，全球能源与水交换（GEWEX）计划启动了“初始化的陆地温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响”（LS4P）倡议，作为一个社区努力，测试高山地区的陆地温度对气候模型的S2S预测的影响。这项研究首次揭示，高山陆地温度可能是S2S降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”地区的海洋表面温度一样大。LS4P的目标是检查观察到的2003年5月青藏 Plateau异常是否导致了全球热点地区观察到的6月降水异常。
challengesCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置对这一努力至关重要，但仍然具有科学挑战性。大多数关于陆地-大气相互作用的研究受到观测数据不足的限制，往往集中于局部反馈。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，原因在于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷。有两个问题需要进一步研究：1）集合均值产生的2米气温（T2m）差异小于观测异常。这种缺陷是否会导致对热带气候（TP）T2m效应的低估？2）在某些地区，集合均值产生了显著的6月降水差异，例如在西澳大利亚和西欧，但与观测结果的符号相反。这是由于模型在产生完整的TP T2m异常和/或正确的降水异常方面的缺陷，还是由于其他涉及的过程？
methodsCn: 在本研究中，观察到的T2m记录用于检查TP T2m与全球降水之间的可能关系，并识别出初始化TP 5月地面温度可能增强6月降水预测技能的位置（热点）。进行了两组实验，使用16个最先进的LS4P ESMs（见表ES1）。在第一个实验（称为控制运行）中，我们评估ESMs是否能够正确产生2003年5月的TP T2m异常和6月的降水异常。为了减轻ESMs在5月TP T2m上的偏差，并生成观察到的寒冷TP春季异常，我们引入了一种创新的方法来初始化TP上的LST/SUBT。在根据每个模型的T2m偏差和TP上的观察异常调整LST/SUBT初始条件后，进行第二个实验（称为敏感性运行），该实验使用新的TP LST/SUBT初始条件，所有其他初始和边界条件及集合成员与第一个实验相同。
datasetCn: 在本研究中，使用了中国气象局（CMA）的T2m数据，该数据涵盖了青藏 Plateau（TP）上的80个站点以及中国境内超过2400个站点。气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据用于其他地区。气候研究单位（CRU）的数据用于全球降水。
findingsCn: 这项研究首次揭示，高山地区的地面温度可能是季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”区域的海洋表面温度相当；在一些“热点”区域，集合均值产生的观测异常超过40%。来自观测和多种地球系统模型（ESM）实验的一致结果表明，通过对青藏 Plateau（TP）地区的地面温度进行LST/SUBT初始化，可以改善5月TP地区的地面温度模拟，从而使ESM更好地预测6月在热点地区的降水，并且高山地区的地面温度可能成为通过升高加热提供S2S可预测性的一个新来源。

background: The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Improving the prediction skill at S2S timescale requires a further understanding of the mechanisms at work for climate variabilities at this timescale as well as the identification of predictability sources. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment.
challenges: The participant models that fail in capturing the TRC wave train greatly under-predict climate anomalies in reference to observations and the successful models. However, the simulated propagation pathways from the TP into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis.
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned. Furthermore, the TP surface temperature anomaly can influence the Southern Hemispheric circulation by generating cross-equator wave trains.
backgroundCn: 在亚季节到季节（S2S）时间尺度上成功预测干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测面临的主要挑战之一，预测失败可能对社会和经济造成重大不利影响。提高S2S时间尺度的预测技能需要进一步理解该时间尺度气候变率的机制以及识别可预测性来源。最近的研究表明，春季地表/地下温度（LST/SUBT）为S2S时间尺度提供了一种新的可预测性来源。全球能源与水循环交换（GEWEX）计划已启动“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测影响（LS4P）”项目，以研究春季LST/SUBT异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。
research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化地表温度和雪盖对季节内到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季地表温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的16个当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季天山地区地表冷却的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。
challengesCn: 未能捕捉到TRC波列的参与模型在参考观测和成功模型时大大低估了气候异常。然而，从青藏 Plateau（TP）到南半球的模拟传播路径存在较大的模型间差异。
methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常对全球的影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与5月TP表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP气温上的偏差。
datasetCn: 在图1a中显示了青藏高原（TP）地区的T2m异常，我们使用来自美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS，Fan和van den Dool 2008）的数据。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气重分析（ERA5，Hersbach等，2020），该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的规则水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位（CRU），在实施分析时使用版本4.02。
findingsCn: LS4P-I的结果首次表明，春季的温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球（TRC）波列，从青藏 Plateau 通过东北亚和白令海峡传递到北美西部，并与春季的西风急流相互作用。这些结果表明，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过 TRC 波列是上述地区季节到季节变率的主要来源。此外，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度异常还可以通过生成跨赤道波列影响南半球的环流。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a challenge encountered when using datasets to predict subseasonal-to-seasonal climate events?

Example.AnswerEn: One challenge is that current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and reanalysis data, which provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. This can result in underestimation of the Tibetan Plateau T2m effect and incorrect precipitation anomaly predictions.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个挑战是，当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化和再分析数据的缺陷，这些缺陷导致初始的大气/陆地条件不平衡。这可能导致对青藏高原2米气温效应的低估以及降水异常预测的不准确。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT)' in subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models?
Definition.QuestionCn: “地表温度/地下温度（LST/SUBT）”在亚季节到季节预测模型中的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) is considered a new source of predictability at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales. It has been shown to influence atmospheric circulation patterns, such as the Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train, which can affect summer precipitation predictions. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program initiated projects to study these impacts, emphasizing the role of LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas.
Definition.AnswerCn: 地表温度/地下温度（LST/SUBT）被认为是亚季节到季节（S2S）时间尺度上的一种新预测源。研究表明，它会影响大气环流模式，例如青藏高原-落基山脉环全球（TRC）波列，这可能影响夏季降水预测。全球能源与水循环（GEWEX）计划启动了研究这些影响的项目，强调了高山地区LST/SUBT异常的作用。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced when using ensemble simulations for predicting atmospheric circulation anomalies due to land surface temperature anomalies versus sea surface temperature anomalies?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用集合模拟预测由于陆面温度异常引起的大气环流异常与由于海面温度异常引起的大气环流异常时面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Challenges in using ensemble simulations for land surface temperature anomalies include large inter-model differences and an inability to fully preserve the memory of initialized anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations. In contrast, sea surface temperature anomalies are generally better understood, but still present challenges in capturing the full extent of their influence on atmospheric circulation, particularly in terms of phase differences and regional biases.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 使用集合模拟来研究陆地表面温度异常面临的挑战包括模型之间的巨大差异，以及由于模型参数化的缺陷，无法完全保留初始化异常的记忆。相比之下，海表温度异常通常更易于理解，但在捕捉其对大气环流的全面影响方面仍然存在挑战，特别是在相位差异和区域偏差方面。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do datasets used for Tibetan Plateau land surface temperature anomalies differ from those used for global precipitation data in terms of their sources and spatial resolution?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 用于青藏 Plateau 地表温度异常的数据集与用于全球降水数据的数据集在来源和空间分辨率方面有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Datasets for Tibetan Plateau land surface temperature anomalies often involve specific high-resolution observational data, such as from the Chinese Meteorological Administration and CAMS, with a focus on capturing local temperature variations. In contrast, global precipitation data typically come from broader datasets like the Climate Research Unit (CRU), which provide comprehensive but less localized coverage, often at a coarser spatial resolution.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 关于青藏高原地表温度异常的数据集通常涉及特定的高分辨率观测数据，例如来自中国气象局和CAMS的数据，重点捕捉局部温度变化。相比之下，全球降水数据通常来自更广泛的数据集，如气候研究单位（CRU），这些数据集提供全面但覆盖范围较广的资料，通常具有较粗的空间分辨率。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can researchers address the challenges of inter-model differences when simulating the propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 研究人员如何应对在模拟从青藏高原传播路径到南半球时模型间差异的挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The challenges highlight the need for robust land initialization and model configuration. Addressing these issues could involve refining model parameterizations and ensuring balanced initial atmospheric and land conditions from reanalysis data to improve inter-model consistency.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 这些挑战突显了强健的土地初始化和模型配置的必要性。解决这些问题可能涉及优化模型参数化，并确保从再分析数据中获得平衡的初始大气和土地条件，以提高模型间的一致性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What potential datasets could be utilized to explore the relationship between land surface temperatures and subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation prediction, especially in regions affected by the Tibetan Plateau's thermal state?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以利用哪些潜在数据集来探索地表温度与季节内到季节性降水预测之间的关系，特别是在受到青藏 Plateau 热状态影响的地区？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Datasets from the Chinese Meteorological Administration, Climate Anomaly Monitoring System, ECMWF reanalysis, and Climate Research Unit provide observational data on temperature and precipitation that can be used to study these relationships. These datasets offer insights into the spatial and temporal patterns necessary for understanding land-atmosphere interactions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 来自中国气象局、气候异常监测系统、欧洲中期天气预报中心重分析和气候研究单位的数据集提供了关于温度和降水的观测数据，可用于研究这些关系。这些数据集提供了理解陆地-大气相互作用所需的空间和时间模式的见解。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenge of accurately predicting subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation using land surface temperature data?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 哪些因素导致使用地表温度数据准确预测亚季节到季节降水的挑战？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenge of accurately predicting subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation using land surface temperature data arises from several factors, including significant errors in producing observed Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures, model deficiencies in preserving memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies, and the complexity of land-atmosphere interactions. Additionally, the inability of models to fully capture the observed anomalies in temperature and precipitation due to unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions contributes to the difficulty.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 使用地表温度数据准确预测亚季节到季节的降水面临多个挑战，包括在生成观察到的青藏高原表面温度时存在显著误差、模型在保持初始化的地表温度异常记忆方面的缺陷，以及陆气相互作用的复杂性。此外，模型无法充分捕捉到温度和降水的观察异常，原因在于初始大气/陆地条件的不平衡，这也增加了预测的难度。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a need to explore new sources of predictability in subseasonal-to-seasonal climate prediction models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么需要在亚季节到季节的气候预测模型中探索新的可预测性来源？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Exploring new sources of predictability in subseasonal-to-seasonal climate prediction models is necessary because traditional sources, like sea surface temperature anomalies, only partially explain climate predictability. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature provides a new source of predictability, as it can modulate atmospheric circulation patterns and influence precipitation in various regions. This new source of predictability is crucial for improving the skill of weather and climate predictions at S2S time scales, which is essential to mitigate adverse impacts on societies and economies.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 探索亚季节到季节气候预测模型中的新预测来源是必要的，因为传统来源，如海表温度异常，仅部分解释气候的可预测性。最近的研究表明，春季陆地表面/地下温度提供了一种新的可预测性来源，因为它可以调节大气环流模式并影响各个地区的降水。这一新的可预测性来源对于提高亚季节到季节时间尺度的天气和气候预测技能至关重要，这对减轻对社会和经济的不利影响至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the variability in model responses when simulating the influence of Tibetan Plateau land surface temperature anomalies on global atmospheric circulation?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在模拟西藏高原地表温度异常对全球大气环流影响时，模型响应的变异性是什么原因造成的？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The variability in model responses when simulating the influence of Tibetan Plateau land surface temperature anomalies on global atmospheric circulation is caused by inter-model differences in capturing the propagation pathways and wave train patterns. These differences result in inconsistencies between simulations and observations, especially in the Southern Hemisphere's atmospheric responses. The inability of certain models to accurately simulate the TRC wave train and the associated climate anomalies also contributes to this variability.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在模拟西藏高原地表温度异常对全球大气环流影响时，模型响应的变异性是由于模型之间在捕捉传播路径和波列模式方面的差异。这些差异导致模拟结果与观测结果之间的不一致，特别是在南半球的大气响应中。某些模型无法准确模拟TRC波列及相关气候异常，也加剧了这种变异性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using different initialization techniques for land surface temperature anomalies on the accuracy of subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用不同的地表温度异常初始化技术对亚季节到季节降水预测的准确性可能产生的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of different initialization techniques for land surface temperature anomalies can significantly affect the accuracy of subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictions. Effective initialization can improve the representation of observed anomalies in climate models, potentially enhancing prediction skill over global 'hotspot' regions. However, deficiencies in initialization techniques may lead to biases that underestimate the impact of land temperature anomalies, resulting in less accurate predictions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 不同的地表温度异常初始化技术的使用可能会显著影响亚季节到季节的降水预测准确性。有效的初始化可以改善气候模型中观测到的异常表现，潜在地提高全球“热点”区域的预测技能。然而，初始化技术的缺陷可能导致偏差，低估地表温度异常的影响，从而导致预测不够准确。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the integration of data from both satellite and ground-based observations influence the accuracy of atmospheric circulation models in predicting global climatic events?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 卫星和地面观测数据的整合如何影响大气环流模型在预测全球气候事件中的准确性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating data from both satellite and ground-based observations can enhance the accuracy of atmospheric circulation models by providing comprehensive datasets that cover various spatial resolutions and environmental conditions. This integration can facilitate improved model parameterizations and initialization, potentially leading to more accurate predictions of global climatic events, especially in regions sensitive to land surface and subsurface temperature anomalies.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合卫星和地面观测数据可以通过提供覆盖各种空间分辨率和环境条件的综合数据集，增强大气环流模型的准确性。这种整合可以促进模型参数化和初始化的改进，从而可能导致对全球气候事件的更准确预测，特别是在对地表和地下温度异常敏感的地区。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications of model biases on the interpretation of atmospheric circulation responses in climate prediction studies?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 模型偏差对气候预测研究中大气环流响应的解释有什么影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Model biases can significantly influence the interpretation of atmospheric circulation responses, potentially leading to inconsistencies between simulated and observed anomalies. Such biases may result in incorrect predictions of climate variability and teleconnection patterns, affecting the reliability of climate prediction studies. Addressing these biases is crucial for enhancing model performance and ensuring accurate representation of atmospheric processes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 模型偏差可能会显著影响对大气环流响应的解释，可能导致模拟与观测异常之间的不一致。这些偏差可能导致气候变率和遥相关模式的错误预测，从而影响气候预测研究的可靠性。解决这些偏差对于提高模型性能和确保大气过程的准确表示至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind creating a dataset that simulates atmospheric conditions over specific regions using high-resolution models like WRF?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用像WRF这样的高分辨率模型模拟特定区域的大气条件的数据集的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to understand and predict the impact of terrain and atmospheric conditions on weather patterns, particularly focusing on subseasonal to seasonal prediction challenges such as droughts and floods, using detailed atmospheric simulations informed by models like WRF and data sources such as ERA-interim and OISST.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是理解和预测地形和大气条件对天气模式的影响，特别关注亚季节到季节预测中的挑战，如干旱和洪水，使用像WRF这样的详细大气模拟和ERA-interim及OISST等数据源。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to utilize multiple Earth System Models (ESMs) in studying the effects of land surface temperature anomalies over high mountain areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在研究高山地区地表温度异常的影响时，利用多个地球系统模型（ESMs）是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Utilizing multiple ESMs allows researchers to explore the variability and response of atmospheric circulations to land surface temperature anomalies, helping to identify their influence on global weather patterns and improve the predictability of subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation events across different regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 利用多个地球系统模型（ESMs）可以帮助研究人员探索大气环流对陆地表面温度异常的变异性和响应，从而识别它们对全球天气模式的影响，并提高不同地区亚季节到季节性降水事件的可预测性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What techniques are used to initialize land surface temperature and snowpack data in climate models to enhance subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction accuracy?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在气候模型中，使用哪些技术来初始化地表温度和雪盖数据，以提高亚季节到季节的预测准确性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: A novel approach is used to initialize land surface temperature (LST) and subsurface temperature (SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau by adjusting the initial conditions based on each model’s temperature bias and observed anomaly. This involves conducting two sets of experiments: a control run to evaluate model performance and a sensitivity run using new LST/SUBT initial conditions to generate observed cold spring anomalies.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 一种新颖的方法用于初始化青藏高原的地表温度（LST）和地下温度（SUBT），通过根据每个模型的温度偏差和观测异常调整初始条件。这涉及进行两组实验：一组是控制运行，用于评估模型性能；另一组是灵敏度运行，使用新的LST/SUBT初始条件生成观测到的寒春异常。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural challenges are encountered when attempting to preserve the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies in climate models, and how are these addressed?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在气候模型中，试图保存初始化的地表温度异常的记忆时，会遇到哪些程序性挑战，以及这些挑战是如何解决的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Challenges include deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions in reanalysis data. These are addressed by robust land initialization techniques and model configuration adjustments, focusing on reducing biases in temperature anomalies and aligning model outputs with observed data to preserve the influence of initialized conditions on prediction accuracy.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 挑战包括模型参数化的不足和再分析数据中不平衡的初始大气/陆地条件。这些问题通过稳健的陆地初始化技术和模型配置调整来解决，重点是减少温度异常的偏差，并使模型输出与观测数据对齐，以保持初始化条件对预测准确性的影响。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What computational advancements have facilitated the creation of high-resolution weather simulations like those used in TPEMIP WRF models?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些计算进展促进了像TPEMIP WRF模型中使用的高分辨率天气模拟的创建？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model, which leverages initial and boundary conditions from ERA-interim and OISST, along with a 0.18-degree horizontal resolution, has enabled the creation of detailed simulations. These advancements allow for the detailed analysis of atmospheric conditions and processes crucial for weather prediction and climate studies.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用天气研究与预报（WRF）模型，该模型利用来自ERA-interim和OISST的初始和边界条件，并具有0.18度的水平分辨率，已经能够创建详细的模拟。这些进展使得对大气条件和过程的详细分析成为可能，这对于天气预测和气候研究至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What are the key challenges in using ensemble model simulations to predict climate anomalies such as those stemming from the Tibetan Plateau's land surface temperature anomalies?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 使用集合模型模拟预测气候异常（例如源于青藏 Plateau 的地表温度异常）面临的主要挑战有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Key challenges include inter-model differences in simulating propagation pathways, biases in temperature anomalies, and inconsistencies with observed data. These issues can lead to discrepancies in the predicted climate anomalies and require robust initialization techniques and model configurations to improve accuracy and reliability of predictions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 主要挑战包括模型之间在模拟传播路径方面的差异、温度异常的偏差以及与观测数据的不一致。这些问题可能导致预测的气候异常出现差异，因此需要强有力的初始化技术和模型配置，以提高预测的准确性和可靠性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the land surface temperature anomalies over the Tibetan Plateau be considered a new source of predictability for subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation prediction?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么青藏 Plateau 的地表温度异常可能被视为亚季节到季节降水预测的新可预测性来源？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface temperature and subsurface temperature over high mountain areas like the Tibetan Plateau can impact summertime precipitation predictions. This is due to the modulation of atmospheric circulation patterns, such as the Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal wave train, which influences regions downstream and contributes to subseasonal-to-seasonal variability.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 最近的研究表明，春季高山地区（如青藏 Plateau）的地表温度和地下温度会影响夏季降水预测。这是因为它们调节了大气环流模式，例如青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球波列，这影响了下游地区，并有助于亚季节到季节的变率。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the challenges in utilizing observed land surface temperature data for improving subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 利用观测地表温度数据来改善亚季节到季节预测模型面临的挑战有哪些？
Expectation.AnswerEn: One major challenge is the inability of current Earth System Models to fully capture the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and reanalysis data. Additionally, the ensemble mean of model simulations tends to underestimate observed temperature anomalies, which may lead to inaccurate predictions of precipitation anomalies in some regions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 一个主要挑战是当前的地球系统模型无法充分捕捉初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化和再分析数据的缺陷。此外，模型模拟的集合均值往往低估观察到的温度异常，这可能导致某些地区降水异常的预测不准确。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be significant differences in the model simulations of the propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么从青藏高原向南半球传播路径的模型模拟可能存在显著差异？
Expectation.AnswerEn: There are large inter-model differences in the simulated propagation pathways, which may be due to variability in model parameterizations and the inability to accurately simulate the complex interactions between the Tibetan Plateau surface anomalies and global atmospheric circulations. This results in inconsistencies between model predictions and observed atmospheric responses, particularly in the Southern Hemisphere.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在模拟传播路径方面，模型之间存在较大的差异，这可能是由于模型参数化的变异性以及无法准确模拟青藏高原表面异常与全球大气环流之间复杂相互作用所致。这导致模型预测与观测到的大气响应之间存在不一致，特别是在南半球。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are your thoughts on the potential for utilizing additional observational datasets to enhance the accuracy of predictions related to droughts and floods in the regions influenced by the Tibetan Plateau’s surface temperature anomalies?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对利用额外的观测数据集来提高与受青藏 Plateau表面温度异常影响的地区的干旱和洪水预测准确性的潜力有何看法？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Utilizing additional observational datasets could significantly enhance prediction accuracy for droughts and floods influenced by the Tibetan Plateau’s surface temperature anomalies. Datasets such as the CAMS T2m, ERA5 reanalysis, and CRU precipitation data provide valuable insights and could be leveraged further to refine models. The inclusion of comprehensive land-atmosphere interaction data could also improve model initialization and help reduce biases, thereby strengthening prediction capabilities.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 利用额外的观测数据集可以显著提高受青藏 Plateau 表面温度异常影响的干旱和洪水预测准确性。像 CAMS T2m、ERA5 再分析和 CRU 降水数据这样的数据集提供了宝贵的见解，可以进一步利用这些数据来优化模型。综合的陆气相互作用数据的纳入也可以改善模型初始化，帮助减少偏差，从而增强预测能力。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods can accurately measure the influence of land surface temperature anomalies on global atmospheric circulation.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何能够准确测量地表温度异常对全球大气环流的影响。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The impact of land surface temperature anomalies is studied through numerical experiments using Earth System Models (ESMs), where the initialization of land surface temperature and subsurface conditions over regions like the Tibetan Plateau is crucial. These models simulate atmospheric responses to such anomalies, providing insights into the influence on global circulation patterns.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 通过使用地球系统模型（ESMs）进行数值实验，研究了地表温度异常的影响，其中对像青藏高原这样的地区的地表温度和地下条件的初始化至关重要。这些模型模拟了大气对这些异常的响应，提供了对全球环流模式影响的洞察。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the challenges associated with initializing land temperature data in high mountain regions for improving subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 概述在高山地区初始化地面温度数据以改善亚季节到季节预测模型所面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include maintaining robust land initialization and model configuration, as current models struggle to preserve memory from initialized land surface temperature (LST) anomalies. This is due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial conditions provided by reanalysis data. Additionally, achieving accurate initialization of LST requires addressing model biases and improving observational data coverage.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括保持强健的土地初始化和模型配置，因为当前模型在保持初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆方面存在困难。这是由于模型参数化的不足和再分析数据提供的不平衡初始条件所致。此外，实现LST的准确初始化需要解决模型偏差和改善观测数据覆盖。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential datasets that can be used for analyzing the global response of atmospheric circulation to land surface temperature anomalies.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别可以用于分析大气环流对陆地表面温度异常的全球响应的潜在数据集。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include the NOAA Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) T2m data, ERA5 atmospheric reanalysis data, and the Climate Research Unit (CRU) global precipitation data. These datasets offer information on temperature anomalies, atmospheric circulation, and precipitation patterns, which are crucial for analyzing the impact of land surface temperature anomalies on global atmospheric circulation.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括NOAA气候异常监测系统（CAMS）T2m数据、ERA5大气重分析数据和气候研究单位（CRU）全球降水数据。这些数据集提供了温度异常、大气环流和降水模式的信息，这对于分析地表温度异常对全球大气环流的影响至关重要。
